str2: A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
This; he, she, it.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.
And, even, also, namely.
Wise, learned, cultivated, skilled, clever. Akin to saphes; wise.
And, even, also, namely.
From gramma. A writer, i.e. scribe or secretary.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To put to death, kill; fig: I abolish. From apo and kteino; to kill outright; figuratively, to destroy.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From stauros; to impale on the cross; figuratively, to extinguish passion or selfishness.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To flog, scourge, the victim being strapped to a pole or frame; met: I chastise. From mastix; to flog.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From sunago; an assemblage of persons; specially, a Jewish 'synagogue'; by analogy, a Christian church.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To pursue, hence: I persecute. A prolonged form of a primary verb dio; to pursue; by implication, to persecute.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
